User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user with administrative access to the website.

firstName.description: The first name of the user.

lastName.description: The last name of the user.

definition.description: Collection to store admin user IDs. Presence of a document with a userId grants admin privileges.  Authentication depends solely on `request.auth.uid`.

params.name: userId
params.description: The Firebase Auth UID of the admin user.

firestore.reasoning:
Given the requirement for an admin login page, and the provided User entity, the most straightforward approach is to store admin user credentials in a dedicated collection. This allows for easy role management without custom claims. The structure focuses on simplicity and security by limiting access based on the existence of a user ID within the `/roles_admin` collection. This approach adheres to Authorization Independence (CRITICAL), and provides Clarity of Intent (Debuggability).

The structure supports the required QAPs by:

*   **Segregation:**  Admin user data is segregated into its own collection (`/roles_admin`), allowing for specific security rules that apply only to administrative users.
*   **Global Roles (DBAC):** The existence of a document in `/roles_admin/{uid}` signifies admin status.
